blogs.title: Managing Gastrointestinal Bleeding: Surgical & Non-Surgical Approaches
blogs.medically_reviewed_by: Gastroenterology Team at Omni Hospitals

paragraphs: Gastrointestinal (GI) bleeding is a serious medical condition that can occur anywhere along the digestive tract, from the mouth to the anus. It can be caused by a wide range of conditions, from peptic ulcers to cancers, and may manifest as either upper GI bleeding (bleeding from the esophagus, stomach, or duodenum) or lower GI bleeding (bleeding from the colon, rectum, or anus). Regardless of the source, GI bleeding requires prompt and effective management to prevent severe blood loss, shock, and other complications.

This blog will explore both surgical and non-surgical approaches to managing gastrointestinal bleeding, outlining when each method is appropriate, and highlighting key treatment options available for patients.

sections.heading: Understanding Gastrointestinal Bleeding
sections.subheading: GI bleeding is typically classified into two categories:
list: Upper GI Bleeding: This originates from sources such as the esophagus, stomach, or duodenum. Common causes include peptic ulcers, gastritis, esophageal varices, and stomach cancer. Symptoms often include vomiting blood (hematemesis), black, tarry stools (melena), and in severe cases, shock.

Lower GI Bleeding: This originates from the small intestine, colon, rectum, or anus. Common causes include hemorrhoids, diverticulosis, colorectal cancer, and inflammatory bowel disease (IBD). Symptoms often include blood in the stool, which can range from bright red blood to dark, maroon-colored stools.
subpara: Prompt recognition and early intervention are essential in managing GI bleeding. Without timely treatment, significant blood loss can lead to anemia, hypovolemic shock, or organ failure.

list: Vomiting blood or coffee-ground material
Black or bloody stools
Abdominal pain or cramping
Weakness or dizziness
Shortness of breath
Pale skin (in severe cases, due to blood loss)

sections.subheading: Non-Surgical Approaches to Managing GI Bleeding
paragraphs: Non-surgical methods are often the first line of treatment for GI bleeding, especially if the bleeding is mild to moderate and the source is identified early. Here are several non-surgical approaches:

Endoscopic procedures are crucial for diagnosing and managing upper GI bleeding. Esophagogastroduodenoscopy (EGD) is commonly used to visualize the esophagus, stomach, and duodenum. Endoscopic interventions can help locate the source of bleeding and may even provide immediate treatment options. Some of these treatments include:
list: Injection therapy: Injecting medications (such as epinephrine) directly into the bleeding site to constrict blood vessels and reduce bleeding.
Thermal coagulation: Using heat to cauterize the bleeding vessel.
Hemoclip placement: Using clips to physically close off the bleeding vessel.

paragraphs: Medications play an essential role in managing GI bleeding, particularly in patients with conditions such as peptic ulcers or esophageal varices. Some common pharmacological treatments include:
list: Proton Pump Inhibitors (PPIs): These drugs help reduce stomach acid, promoting ulcer healing and reducing the risk of further bleeding. PPIs are commonly used in managing peptic ulcers and gastritis.

Octreotide: This medication is particularly useful in cases of variceal bleeding (bleeding from enlarged veins in the esophagus). It reduces portal pressure and can help control bleeding from esophageal varices.
Antibiotics: In patients with cirrhosis or varices, prophylactic antibiotics are often used to prevent infections that can worsen the bleeding.

paragraphs: In some cases, angiography is used to locate the source of bleeding when endoscopy is not effective, especially in lower GI bleeding. Angiographic embolization involves injecting small particles or coils into the blood vessels supplying the bleeding area to stop the flow of blood. This is particularly useful for patients with active bleeding that cannot be controlled through endoscopic methods.

If a patient experiences significant blood loss, a blood transfusion may be necessary to restore blood volume and prevent hypovolemic shock. Transfusions are especially critical in patients with anemia or those who are hemodynamically unstable due to blood loss.

In addition to specific treatments aimed at controlling bleeding, supportive care is crucial in stabilizing the patient. This can include intravenous fluids to maintain blood pressure, oxygen therapy to address respiratory concerns, and nutritional support in patients with ongoing gastrointestinal issues.

sections.heading: Surgical Approaches to Managing GI Bleeding
paragraphs: If non-surgical methods fail to control the bleeding or if the source is difficult to identify, surgical intervention may be necessary. Surgery is typically reserved for severe cases or when conservative measures have proven ineffective.

If the source of bleeding is a localized area of the GI tract, such as a tumor, severely diseased bowel, or a large ulcer, a surgical resection may be performed. This involves removing the affected portion of the organ (e.g., part of the colon or stomach) to stop the bleeding.
list: Gastrectomy: Removal of part or all of the stomach in cases like gastric cancer or severe ulcers.
Colectomy: Removal of part or all of the colon in conditions like diverticular disease or colorectal cancer.

paragraphs: In cases where the source of bleeding is unidentified or cannot be controlled with other interventions, a laparotomy (surgical exploration of the abdomen) may be performed. The surgeon will open the abdominal cavity to locate the source of bleeding and control it through direct pressure, cauterization, or other surgical methods.

In certain cases of peptic ulcer disease, where bleeding is recurrent or difficult to control, a vagotomy (cutting the vagus nerve) may be performed. This reduces stomach acid production and promotes healing of the ulcers.

For patients with esophageal varices or other complex vascular abnormalities, stent placement may be used to control bleeding. In cases of variceal bleeding, a TIPS procedure (transjugular intrahepatic portosystemic shunt) can be used to divert blood flow and reduce portal pressure, thus minimizing the risk of bleeding.

sections.heading: When to Seek Immediate Medical Attention
paragraphs: Gastrointestinal bleeding is a medical emergency, and prompt intervention is crucial to prevent life-threatening complications. Seek immediate medical attention if you experience:
list: Persistent abdominal pain or cramping
Blood in your stool (either bright red or black and tarry)
Vomiting blood or coffee-ground material
Dizziness, fainting, or confusion
Weakness, paleness, or cold extremities

sections.heading: Conclusion
paragraphs: Gastrointestinal bleeding can arise from many causes and present in varying degrees of severity. Whether treated through non-surgical methods such as endoscopy, medication, or angiography, or surgical approaches like resection or laparotomy, timely and effective management is essential for a successful outcome.

Patients experiencing GI bleeding should seek immediate medical attention to prevent further complications. With early detection and appropriate treatment, most patients can recover fully and return to a healthy, active life.
If you or a loved one is dealing with gastrointestinal bleeding, consult with a gastroenterologist or surgeon to discuss the best course of treatment and improve your chances of recovery.

Pancreatic Surgery for Chronic Pancreatitis: A Step-by-Step Guide

blogs.title: Pancreatic Surgery for Chronic Pancreatitis: A Step-by-Step Guide
blogs.medically_reviewed_by: Gastroenterology Team at Omni Hospitals

paragraphs: Chronic pancreatitis is a long-term inflammation of the pancreas that can cause severe pain, digestive problems, and complications such as diabetes and malnutrition. When medications and lifestyle changes fail to provide relief, pancreatic surgery becomes a necessary option to alleviate symptoms and improve the patient’s quality of life.

This comprehensive guide will walk you through the step-by-step process of pancreatic surgery for chronic pancreatitis, including preparation, the surgical procedure, recovery, and long-term management.

sections.heading: What is Chronic Pancreatitis?
paragraphs: Chronic pancreatitis is a progressive inflammatory disease that causes permanent damage to the pancreas. The pancreas is responsible for producing digestive enzymes and insulin, which help regulate blood sugar levels. Over time, repeated inflammation leads to scarring (fibrosis), reducing the organ’s ability to function properly.

sections.heading: Causes of Chronic Pancreatitis
list: Chronic alcohol consumption (major cause in adults)
Genetic factors
Gallstones or bile duct obstruction
Autoimmune diseases
High triglyceride levels
Smoking
Idiopathic pancreatitis (unknown causes)

sections.heading: Symptoms of Chronic Pancreatitis
list: Severe, persistent abdominal pain
Unintentional weight loss
Greasy, foul-smelling stools (steatorrhea)
Nausea and vomiting
Diabetes due to loss of insulin production
Medical History & Physical Examination: The surgeon reviews past medical conditions, symptoms, and treatment history. A complete assessment of pancreatic function and related complications is done.
Diagnostic Imaging Tests: CT Scan, MRI, Endoscopic Ultrasound (EUS), and MRCP to assess damage and detect strictures or cysts.
Blood Tests: To check for diabetes, malnutrition, and infection risks.
Patients with malnutrition may need enzyme supplements or vitamin therapy before surgery.
Smoking and alcohol cessation is essential for better healing.

sections.heading: Step 2: Types of Pancreatic Surgery for Chronic Pancreatitis

paragraphs: If the pancreatic duct is blocked, a drainage procedure may be performed.
list: Lateral Pancreaticojejunostomy: The main pancreatic duct is opened and attached to the small intestine (jejunum), allowing enzymes to flow normally and relieve pain. Best suited for patients with dilated pancreatic ducts.
Distal Pancreatectomy: Removes the tail and body of the pancreas. Often includes spleen removal.
Pancreaticoduodenectomy (Whipple Procedure): Removes the head of the pancreas and parts of the stomach, bile duct, and small intestine. Common in cases with tumors or bile duct obstruction.

paragraphs: Recommended for severe cases where the entire pancreas is damaged. This results in permanent diabetes and requires lifelong insulin therapy.
Some patients may receive auto-islet cell transplantation to reduce the impact of diabetes.

list: Hospital stay: 5–10 days depending on the procedure.
Pain Management: Initially IV medication, then oral painkillers.
Diet: Start with liquid diet and progress to soft foods.
Avoid heavy lifting and follow wound care instructions.
Follow-up visits for stitch removal and recovery monitoring.
Dietary Changes: Low-fat diet, enzyme supplements, vitamin intake.
Diabetes Management: Insulin therapy if pancreas is removed.
Physical Activity: Resume normal activities gradually after 6–8 weeks.
Small, frequent meals with high protein and low fat.
Pancreatic enzyme supplements for digestion.
Vitamin D and calcium supplements to prevent bone loss.

paragraphs: Many patients experience significant pain relief after surgery. Some may still require long-term pain management.
Patients undergoing total pancreatectomy will develop Type 1 diabetes and require lifelong insulin therapy.

list: Avoid alcohol and smoking.
Regular checkups with a gastroenterologist.

sections.heading: Conclusion
paragraphs: Pancreatic surgery for chronic pancreatitis can be life-changing, providing relief from pain and improving overall health. However, it is a major surgery that requires careful preparation, a skilled surgical team, and a structured recovery plan.

If you or a loved one is struggling with chronic pancreatitis and considering surgery, consult with an experienced pancreatic surgeon to explore the best treatment options. With proper post-surgical care, most patients can return to a better quality of life free from constant pain.

Healthy Eating Habits to Prevent Diarrhoea

blogs.title: Healthy Eating Habits to Prevent Diarrhoea
blogs.author: OMNI Hospitals

paragraphs: Diarrhoea is a common issue experienced by people of all age groups. In most cases, it can bring an individual a lot of discomfort and inconvenience. At the same time, if not well handled in other circumstances, it results in different health challenges, such as dehydration. Whether you have diarrhoea due to allergic reactions or food poisoning, or you are suffering from an irritable bowel condition, your diet and diarrhoea are two linked words. You could eat specific foods during an episode of diarrhoea that may help return your digestive system to normal. Other foods may prolong your symptoms or make them worse.
Understanding the causes of diarrhoea and maintaining good eating habits are the primary ways of preventing and managing it. This blog will cover how to avoid diarrhoea with a proper diet.

list: Infections: Various factors like bacterial, viral, and parasitic infections can cause diarrhoea. Consuming contaminated food and water introduces harmful pathogens into the digestive system.
Food Intolerances: The body of some individuals is intolerant to some food substances like lactose present in dairy products or gluten present in wheat. This results in diarrhoea.
Medications: Some medicines, mainly antibiotics, are associated with destroying useful bacteria in the intestinal tract, thus causing diarrhoea.
Digestive Disorders: Conditions like irritable bowel syndrome, Crohn’s disease, ulcerative colitis, and others can trigger chronic diarrhoea.
Stress and Anxiety: It means that emotional stressors may ultimately disturb the digestive system and hence cause diarrhoea.
paragraphs: Diarrhoea occurs when the digestive system cannot absorb enough water from food and consumed liquids, leading to loose, watery stools. Several factors can cause this condition, including:

sections.subheading: Healthy Eating Habits to Prevent Diarrhoea
list: Maintaining healthy eating habits is crucial for preventing diarrhoea. Here are some effective strategies:

paragraphs: Eat a Balanced Diet
list: Consume a wide variety of fruits, vegetables, whole grains, lean proteins, and healthy fats.

The consumption of foods high in fibre promotes digestion. This is because fruits, vegetables, and whole grains contain dietary fibre that ensures good digestion and prevents constipation. This condition can, in turn, cause diarrhoea if it is too extreme.

paragraphs: Stay Hydrated
list: Drink enough water throughout the day. Dehydration will worsen Diarrhea.
Excessive intake of caffeinated and alcoholic beverages is not advisable because it may result in a dehydrated body and an irritated digestive system.

paragraphs: Practice Food Safety
list: Always wash your hands before handling any food.
Cook the food to the right temperature; this may help kill some bacteria that can cause.
You must refrain from eating raw or undercooked meat, eggs, and seafood.

paragraphs: Limit Fatty Foods
list: High-fat foods can be difficult to digest and may trigger diarrhoea. Avoid frying your food, opt for healthier cooking methods like baking, grilling, or steaming.

paragraphs: Be Cautious with Dairy
list: If lactose intolerant, choose lactose-free dairy products or other non-dairy beverages like almond milk, soy milk, or coconut milk.

paragraphs: Monitor Fibre Intake
list: While fibre is essential for good digestion, overconsumption of insoluble fibre from whole grains and some vegetables may sometimes cause diarrhoea. Balance the intake of this type of fibre by increasing soluble fibre foods like those found in oats, bananas, and apples, which will harden the stool.

paragraphs: Introduce Probiotics
list: Probiotics are beneficial bacteria that keep a clean gut. Add some foods, such as yoghurt, kefir, sauerkraut, kimchi, etc., into your diet to keep your gut fit.

paragraphs: Avoid Trigger Foods
list: Avoid foods that appear to exacerbate diarrhea. Typical triggers include spicy and fatty foods, artificial sweeteners, and some beverages.

paragraphs: Most cases of diarrhea are treated at home. Over-the-counter medications help alleviate symptoms within a very short time. However, it is necessary to see a healthcare provider if it does not show any improvement or occurs with the following severe symptoms. Depending on the cause, your doctor may recommend the following treatment:
list: These medications kill infection-causing bacteria or parasites.
Chronic condition medications: Treatment of underlying diseases, such as inflammatory bowel disease or irritable bowel syndrome, can minimise diarrhoea.
<b>Probiotics: These are dietary supplements containing good bacteria that will fight Diarrhea. Always consult your doctor before taking up probiotics or any other supplement.

paragraphs: Several home remedies can provide relief and promote recovery:
list: BRAT Diet: The BRAT diet, an acronym for Bananas, Rice, Apples, and Toast, can help manage it. These bland foods are not hard to digest and can add bulk to the passages. Those foods are low in fibre and starchy, which goes on to add bulk to your stools. Some of the bland foods can help replace nutrients that you have lost via Diarrhea. For example, potatoes and bananas without skin have potassium, which is a nutrient often washed out by diarrhoea.

Drink Tea: Try some ginger tea; ginger will help soothe Diarrhea due to its anti-inflammatory properties and help your gut. Drink a cup of herbal tea with chamomile; it will help decrease and let you fall asleep. Some studies show that lemongrass tea may alleviate diarrhoea in cases of an underlying viral infection, such as rotavirus, which causes viral gastroenteritis.

Probiotics: Probiotics are sources of “good” bacteria that work in your intestines to create a healthy gut. Good bacteria reside in your intestines, which is crucial to the normal functioning of the gastrointestinal system. They also help protect your intestines from infection.

subsections.subheading: When Should I Call My Doctor About Diarrhoea?
paragraphs: Consult a doctor if it persists for more than a few days or if you experience severe pain, fever, or bloody stools. Furthermore, if you show symptoms of dehydration, get medical attention at a distance since if you wait to address the issue, it might worsen.

Healthy eating can prevent diarrhoea and other digestive problems. If you really understand the causes and how to maintain a well-balanced diet, keep yourself rehydrated, and follow good food safety, you will drastically cut down the risk of acute and chronic Diarrhea. In the case of diarrhea, early diarrhoea treatment and home remedies help alleviate the condition and get back to normalcy. Keep in mind the fact that one has to pay attention to his body and avoid all sorts of food that he knows causes Diarrhea. By following these very simple yet effective measures, one can easily enjoy a fit digestive system and, at large, health.
This article has been medically reviewed by Dr Nagavender Rao M, General Physician

blogs.title: Common Causes of Stomach Infections in Monsoon
blogs.author: OMNI Hospitals

paragraphs: Monsoons cool things down but also bring in various health-related issues, including stomach infections. Stomach infections during this season are quite common, owing to the ideal condition of humidity that helps bacteria, viruses, and parasites grow. Your chances of catching more viruses, bacteria, and other infections are twice as high in monsoons than in other seasons. Many people also experience vomiting and abdominal cramps during this time. Understanding the common causes of stomach infection during monsoon season can help you take preventive measures to keep yourself and your loved ones protected.

sections.heading: Common Stomach Infections During Monsoon
paragraphs: The proliferation of bacteria, viruses, and parasites may increase the chances of stomach infections during the monsoon season. Common stomach infections during this season include:
list: Viral Gastroenteritis: Generally caused by Rotavirus or Norovirus, it may cause diarrhea, vomiting, stomach cramps, and increased temperature.
Bacterial Infections: Infections due to bacteria like E. coli, Salmonella, and Shigella may cause severe diarrhea, abdominal pain, and blood in stools.
Parasitic Infections: Common parasitic infections include giardiasis and amoebiasis. These range from the Giardia to amoebiasis, characterized by chronic diarrhea, stomach cramps, and nausea.

paragraphs: Contaminated water is one of the main reasons for stomach infections during this season. In addition, heavy rains result in water logging. This causes sewage and drainage systems to overflow and contaminate water. This can seep into the drinking water supplies and cause waterborne diseases.
Prevention:
list: Always drink boiled or filtered water.
Avoid drinking tap water from unknown sources. Don’t drink water sold by street vendors.
Keep individual containers for storing water clean and covered.

paragraphs: Another cause of stomach infections during the rainy season is food contamination. Street foods and food stored under unhygienic conditions become a breeding ground for bacteria and viruses since the moisture point becomes higher.
Prevention
list: Eat freshly prepared food.
Stay away from street food and unsanitary eating joints.
Store the food properly in airtight containers to avoid any contamination.

paragraphs: Poor hygiene— like not washing your hands before eating and after using washrooms—is also a reason behind stomach infections. Germs and viruses are more prevalent during monsoon season, so maintaining good hygiene is vital.
Prevention
list: Wash your hands with soap and clean water before meals and always after visiting the toilet.
Use hand sanitisers where soap and water are not available.
Keep your environment clean and free of trash.

paragraphs: Stomach infections can also be contracted by coming into contact—directly or indirectly—with an infected person. For instance, examples of this type of transmission include sharing eating utensils, towels, and other personal list belonging to an infected individual.
Prevention
list: Avoid sharing personal things with others.
Ensure that any infected individual in the household maintains proper hygiene.
Regularly disinfect frequently touched surfaces.

sections.heading: Stomach Virus and Stomach Flu Symptoms
paragraphs: The stomach flu or stomach infection, otherwise known as viral gastroenteritis, can have a wide array of symptoms. It is vital to recognize such symptoms at an early stage for proper treatment.

sections.heading: Common Symptoms
list: Nausea and Vomiting: The majority of the cases concerning the stomach virus have these two as the most dominant symptoms. Serious instances of nausea and vomiting could result in dehydration easily.
Diarrhea: Passage of frequent, watery stools occurs. In some instances, just like vomiting, diarrhea can be very serious and thus cause dehydration.
Stomach Cramps and Pain: Abdominal discomfort and cramping are characteristic symptoms of a stomach infection.
Fever: There may be a mild to moderate fever present with other symptoms.
Fatigue and Weakness: This is due to the amount of energy the body spends fighting off the infection, leading to tiredness or weakness.

sections.heading: Tips to Prevent Gastric Problems in Rainy Season
paragraphs: This rainy season accompanies moisture, creating the perfect ground for growing bacteria and viruses. Gastric troubles, hence, become very common. Here are some tips on prevention measures:
list: Eat Fresh and Well-Cooked Food: Eat freshly prepared, well-cooked food. Avoid stale leftovers that have been stored improperly.
Be Cautious of Street Food: Although tempting, street food is generally prepared in an unhealthy environment. It is best avoided during the rains.
Take Probiotics: Probiotics can be consumed in the form of yogurt and other fermented products. They can help grow good gut flora, which will prevent gastric problems.
Stay Hydrated: Drink plenty of fluids to help your digestive system go through the process smoothly. Water is the main medium through which toxins are flushed out from the body.
Exercise regularly: Have regular exercise for healthy digestion and reducing stress, which can aggravate gastric trouble.
Manage Stress: Avoid stress by using techniques such as meditation, deep breathing, or yoga. Stress may hamper digestion.
Watch what you eat: Avoid fatty, spicy, oily foods that can also upset your stomach. Instead, opt for a balanced diet that is rich in fruits, vegetables, and whole grains.
Watch out for warning signs: If you have gastric symptoms that are persistent or very bad, like diarrhea for several days, non stop vomiting, and abdominal pain, seek medical advice immediately.

paragraphs: By following these simple tips, you can enjoy the rainy season while keeping troublesome gastric problems at bay.

sections.heading: Conclusion
paragraphs: Stomach infections are common during the monsoon season. Still, with the right knowledge and due precautions, you can definitely reduce your risk. Good hygiene maintenance, keeping tabs on what one eats or drinks, and recognizing the symptoms early will help you save yourself and your family from such nasty infections. Remember, keeping yourself rehydrated and getting medical help in time can make all the difference in the management of stomach infections. Get ready to enjoy the monsoons with these simple, effective prevention measures.
This article has been medically reviewed by Dr Nagavender Rao M, General Physician

blogs.title: Raising Awareness on World Hepatitis Day 2024: Fighting Hepatitis Together
blogs.author: OMNI Hospitals

sections.paragraphs: World Hepatitis Day is celebrated on 28th July every year to create awareness among people against a group of infectious diseases: Hepatitis A, B, C, D, and E... eliminating hepatitis and improving health for millions.

sections.subheading: The Importance of World Hepatitis Day
paragraphs: World Hepatitis Day, initiated in 2008, particularly focuses on increasing awareness about the risk of viral hepatitis globally and establishing partnerships for its elimination. The day provides an opportunity to:
list: Raising Awareness:It serves as a way of raising awareness about hepatitis, which relatively remains to be lesser known as compared to other infectious diseases like HIV/AIDS or tuberculosis. Awareness campaigns may enlighten people against myths while availing relevant information in terms of transmission, prevention, and treatment.

Promoting Early Detection: Many people living with hepatitis are unaware of their infection, so the diagnosis may be quite late, at which the disease has already caused substantial damage to the liver. Thus, World Hepatitis Day advocates for people to know their status, which is very important for the early intervention and successful treatment of the infection.

Advocating for Policy Changes: On this day, people may engage in campaign work and put pressure on governments to pass legislation that supports hepatitis research, treatment, and prevention. Better hepatitis treatment programs, funding for hepatitis projects, and improved healthcare facilities are a few examples.

Supporting Affected Individuals: The World Hepatitis Day creates a feeling of togetherness, therefore reducing stigma and discrimination amongst people living with hepatitis, which is vital in the mental and emotional well-being support for the patients.

Encouraging Global Efforts: International efforts must be coordinated to address the global problem of hepatitis. Global Hepatitis Day encourages cooperation between nations, information exchange, and strategic alliances to combat hepatitis more effectively.

paragraphs: World Hepatitis Day features a variety of activities to engage communities and spread awareness globally. The world hepatitis day activities include:
list: Educational Campaigns: Workshops and seminars in schools, universities, and community centers are held to spread awareness about types of hepatitis, symptoms, and modes of prevention.
Screening and Vaccination Drives: Free hepatitis screening and vaccination, especially for hepatitis A and B, facilitate early diagnosis and prevention.
Social Media Campaigns: Hashtags are trending across social media as posts—educational ones and sharing personal stories—are made by influencers and organizations.
Public Seminars and Webinars: It also includes some useful expert sessions on hepatitis research, treatment options, and preventive strategies.
Partnerships and Collaborations: Governments, non-profits, healthcare providers, and the private sector collaborate to enhance the reach and impact of awareness campaigns.

paragraphs: Hepatitis prevention includes vaccination, safe practices, and health education. Here are some key preventive measures:
list: Vaccination: Vaccines against Hepatitis A and B are available. The Hepatitis B vaccine also protects against Hepatitis D. Vaccination campaigns, particularly during the month of Hepatitis Awareness, play a very significant role in preventing infection with these viruses.

Safe Injection Practices: Avoiding contaminated needles and syringes and screening blood products can also prevent the transmission of HBV and HCV. Good and strict infection control practices are to be maintained in healthcare settings.
Safe Sex Practices: Condom use and fewer sexual partners reduce the risk of HBV transmission. Education on safe sex is paramount, more so for high-risk populations.
Personal Hygiene: Good personal hygiene—washing hands frequently and avoiding the sharing of personal list like razors and toothbrushes—prevents hepatitis A and E.
Safe Food and Water: Safe drinking water and safe food can help prevent Hepatitis A and E. Ensure public health measures take adequate attention toward sanitation and hygiene in foods.

Regular Screening: Regular screening for HBV and HCV in high-risk individuals is important. Early detection can ensure a timely treatment that will prevent the progression of serious liver disease in most cases.

Public Education Campaigns: Continuous public education through media and other facilities during Hepatitis Awareness Month and around World Hepatitis Day should be ensured in India and other countries, with a special focus on prevention, symptoms, and the importance of early diagnosis and treatment.

paragraphs: World Hepatitis Day 2024, with the theme “It’s time for action,” is a reminder that the war against hepatitis is far from over. Raising awareness about hepatitis prevention, asking everyone to take necessary precautions, and advancing health policy reform at all levels of government can drive progress toward hepatitis elimination. In other words, world hepatitis day activities and observances, such as Hepatitis Awareness Month, are impossible without the engagement of people, communities, and nations. Together, we can fight hepatitis and support people living with the disease to a future where it no longer exists. This is what we have shown through World Hepatitis Day in India and other parts of the world: a reiteration of our commitment to health and well-being for all, making sure no one gets left behind in this fight.
This article has been medically reviewed by Dr. Ramakanth, a Gastroenterologist & Hepatologist.

blogs.title: World Liver Day 2024: Key Facts about Liver Health

sections.heading: World Liver Day Overview
paragraphs: World Liver Day 2024 is celebrated on April 19 annually to spread awareness about the various diseases of the liver. This day is celebrated annually to bring together communities, medical professionals, and lawmakers to address the growing cases of liver diseases worldwide and promote preventive measures for liver diseases. This year's World Liver Day theme is “Be vigilant, get regular liver check-ups, and prevent fatty liver diseases”.

sections.heading: Why Liver Health is Important
paragraphs: The liver is one of the most vital organs in the body that performs some of the most crucial physiological functions, including detoxification, maintaining good metabolism, and producing vital proteins. It is the largest organ in the body and is responsible for filtering blood before it passes through the rest of the body. Despite its significance in the human body, we tend to ignore our liver health, leading to almost 1.5 billion people suffering from a range of liver diseases, including fatty liver disease, annually. Nearly 2 billion people die every year due to chronic liver diseases. This should encourage us to take steps in the right direction and start following healthy liver practices that promote good liver health.
Interesting Facts About the Liver

The liver plays many vital roles in the body, including filtering toxins and chemicals from the body, which are disposed of as bile and removed from the body via urine or stool. Here are some interesting facts about the human liver:

list: Regenerative ability
subpara: The liver is the only organ in the body that can regrow completely. To do so, only 25% of the liver tissues must remain attached or implanted.

list: Water storage and blood glucose control
subpara: If a person has fatty liver disease, then type-2 diabetes can occur. Blood sugar levels are maintained by converting glucose from carbohydrate-rich foods into glycogen. Glycogen is stored in the liver and absorbs water, making the liver capable of storing water.

list: Maintaining brain function
subpara: The brain's function depends on the liver. The liver maintains plasma glucose and ammonia levels, which can result in encephalopathy and eventually lead to coma if they go out of control. Thus, a healthy liver maintains a functioning brain to some extent.

list: Hormone metabolism
subpara: The liver is a site of hormone breakdown, which is then turned into bile. The bile enters the intestines to get excreted. If the liver cannot break down essential hormones like oestrogen and androgen, many problems and symptoms may appear in males and females.

list: Storage of vitamins and minerals
subpara: The liver also helps store essential vitamins A, D, E, K, and B12, along with minerals like iron and copper.

list: Recycle ground for blood
subpara: The liver can generate new blood during foetal development and recycle blood in adults. It is also responsible for degrading old or damaged blood cells.

list: Determining cholesterol levels
subpara: Liver health is essential for determining cholesterol levels in the body. A fatty liver can mean a high percentage of bad cholesterol or LDL.

sections.subheading: How to Keep Liver Healthy: Tips to Prevent Liver Disease
paragraphs: Liver diseases can be caused by several factors, ranging from genetic factors to excessive alcohol consumption and viral infections. Different liver disorders can cause different liver disease symptoms. Fatty liver disease is one of the most common conditions, and it occurs when the liver accumulates excess fat. Signs of fatty liver disease can be mild or severe depending on how far the condition has progressed. In general, signs of liver damage show a combination of the following symptoms:
list: Fatigue or muscle weakness
Loss of appetite
Loss of weight
Abdominal swelling
Discomfort or pain in the upper right side of the abdomen
Nausea
Yellowing of the skin or eye whites (jaundice) and red palms

paragraphs: In severe cases, liver diseases like fatty liver disease can exhibit signs like:
list: Confusion
Hallucination
Loss of memory
Black or tarry stools
Itching skin or bleeding
subpara: There can also be other chronic and severe liver conditions, like liver cirrhosis and liver failure. These liver diseases can prove to be fatal if not treated on time. Fortunately, there are several things that a person can do to maintain a healthy liver and prevent liver diseases.

paragraphs: Here are some tips for a disease-free, healthy liver:

The most important thing to do to reduce the chances of liver damage is to limit and check the amount of alcohol consumed. Excessive alcohol consumption is one of the leading causes of liver cirrhosis and liver damage.
Obesity is another one of the causes of liver damage, often leading to fatty liver disease. Maintaining a healthy weight and active lifestyle is crucial to good liver health.
A diet rich in saturated and trans fats can contribute to fatty liver disease. Instead, focus on a healthy diet of fruits, vegetables, lean proteins, and whole grains.
Getting screened for liver health can help detect any abnormalities beforehand, enabling doctors to provide timely and adequate liver treatment to prevent complications.
Getting vaccinated against viruses like hepatitis A and B can help prevent potential liver damage due to these viruses.

Using physical barrier methods for intercourse is not only essential to prevent sexually transmitted diseases but also crucial to protect the health of various organs, including the liver. Hepatitis B and C can be transmitted through contact during unprotected intercourse. Thus, practising safe methods of sexual intercourse is imperative to prevent liver diseases.

sections.heading: Taking Care of the Liver
paragraphs: Liver diseases can go unnoticed for many years but may cause severe damage in the meantime, or until the symptoms appear and the disease has already progressed. That’s why regular check-ups of liver health, including the whole body, is extremely crucial to prevent worsening of a liver condition, if present. If there are liver disease symptoms like fatigue, yellowing of the skin or eyes, or abdominal pain, a doctor’s advice should be taken as early as possible.

sections.heading: Conclusion
paragraphs: World Liver Day compels us to pause and reflect on our liver health. It is a reminder to consider steps to improve our liver health and prevent liver diseases. By making healthier lifestyle choices, incorporating liver healthy foods, and visiting the doctor for regular health check-ups, we can ensure maintenance of our liver health, detect any liver issue at the earliest, and ensure that a liver disease can be nipped in the bud. By following the tips to prevent liver disease, we can take steps to maintain good liver health and enhance our quality of life greatly.

blogs.title: Are Antacids Effective in Relieving Acidity and Gas?
blogs.medically_reviewed_by: Dr. Nagavender Rao M, MBBS, MD (General Medicine)

paragraphs: Millions of people worldwide experience the pain and distress that comes with common gastrointestinal problems, including acidity and gas. Antacids are a popular means of treating these medical problems, providing relief from symptoms such as heartburn, indigestion, and bloating. However, do antacids actually work to reduce gas and acidity? It's essential to investigate antacids' components, permitted applications, and target audience to provide a thorough understanding.

sections.heading: Understanding Antacids: Their Function and Purpose
paragraphs: Over-the-counter (OTC) antacids are a group of medications that are used to neutralise stomach acid and create comfort from acid reflux, gas, heartburn, and sour stomach. Pepsin, whose function is to secrete acid that breaks down the food for digestion, is hindered by antacids that neutralise the acid in your stomach. They help in the treatment of the pain caused by acid reflux and related conditions by increasing the stomach pH level, which reduces acidity.

subheading: Symptoms that are relieved by antacids could be:
list: A sensation of burning in the gut and chest, predominantly at night or after eating.
Varying degree of pain in your stomach and chest.
The acidic or sour-like sensation of your tongue.
Feeling full or bloated.
subpara: A lot of people suffering from intermittent gas and acidity prefer antacids because they provide quick and short-term relief.

sections.heading: Components of Antacid Formulations
paragraphs: Antacids comprise a variety of active substances, each of which addresses acid-related symptoms differently. Antacids' active components differ based on their kind and brand. Antacid compositions often comprise the following ingredients:
list: Calcium Carbonate: Known for its rapid elimination of stomach acid, calcium carbonate neutralises stomach acid and relieves heartburn and indigestion quickly.
Aluminium Hydroxide: This substance relieves acid reflux symptoms and lessens gastrointestinal discomfort by neutralising stomach acid and covering the stomach lining in a protective layer.
Magnesium Hydroxide: This substance is helpful for those who are experiencing both acidity and constipation since it neutralises stomach acid and encourages bowel movements in an antacid method.

Simethicone: Known for its capacity to disintegrate gas bubbles in the stomach, Simethicone relieves bloating and other discomforts brought on by an excess of gas. This ingredient is frequently used in antacid formulas.

Sodium Bicarbonate: Sodium bicarbonate, sometimes called baking soda, neutralises stomach acid and can relieve heartburn quickly. However, people on a low-sodium diet or those with hypertension may find it inappropriate because of its high salt level.

Magnesium Carbonate: Because it neutralises excess stomach acid and encourages the ejection of gas from the digestive tract, magnesium carbonate, an ingredient in antacids, helps relieve acidity and gas in two ways, easing gastrointestinal pain in two different ways.

sections.heading: Approved Uses of Antacids
paragraphs: Antacid uses have been licensed by the Food and Drug Administration to treat minor cases of indigestion and heartburn. Heartburn that occurs infrequently or rarely as opposed to daily is referred to as a mild case. Also, these help in reducing :
list: Heartburn
Stomach lining inflammation (gastritis)
Acid reflux (GERD or gastroesophageal reflux disease)
Sour stomach
Upset stomach due to excess acid
Gas and bloating associated with indigestion
subpara: For a few hours, antacids immediately ease discomfort. But it’s important to remember that antacids aren’t meant to cure underlying issues like ulcers or gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD). A medical expert must assess persistent or severe symptoms in order to make the proper diagnosis and course of treatment.

paragraphs: For most people, antacids are generally regarded as safe, including:
list: Adults and minors over the age of twelve (unless instructed differently by the doctor)
Females who are expecting (under the supervision of a healthcare practitioner)
Those without conditions that would prevent them from using a particular antacid component, such as allergies, renal illness, or hypertension
Those looking for relief from sporadic gas and acidity symptoms

paragraphs: Nonetheless, some groups of people should take care or refrain from using antacids entirely, such as:
list: Kidney disease patients: Some are include magnesium or aluminium can build up in the body and impair renal function.
People taking specific medications: Antacids might hinder the absorption of other medications, so it’s important to speak with a doctor before taking them at the same time.
Those with hypertension or heart failure: These medical conditions may be made worse by antacids with a high salt concentration, including sodium bicarbonate.

paragraphs: Although antacids are usually regarded as safe when taken as prescribed, adverse effects are sometimes possible, especially with extended or excessive usage.
list: Constipation or diarrhoea
Headache
Nausea and vomiting
Gas (flatulence)
Abdominal ache or cramps in the stomach

paragraphs: Serious adverse effects could consist of:
list: Rebound Acidity: Using antacids excessively can create rebound acidity, which makes the stomach generate extra acid to make up for the medication’s neutralising effect. Over time, this can exacerbate acidity symptoms.
Neurotoxicity: Antacids alter how your nervous system works.
Hypercalcemia: Excessive levels of calcium in the blood.
Microcytic Anaemia: Iron deficiency.
subpara: Antacids may interfere with the body’s ability to absorb other medications. To find out if taking antacids is suitable for you, speak with your healthcare physician before starting. To avoid interactions with medicines, take other medications (only after the doctor’s recommendation) an hour before or at least four hours after taking an antacid.

sections.subheading: Evaluating the Efficacy of Antacids in Alleviating Acidity & Gas
paragraphs: Antacid efficacy in reducing gas and acidity varies based on a number of factors, such as symptom severity, individual response, and antacid formulation used.
Here are some important things to think about:
list: Prompt Relief: Antacids work quickly to reduce heartburn and indigestion, especially in occasional cases.
Relief from Particular Symptoms: Simethicone-based antacids are best suited for bloating and gas relief, while others target acid neutralisation.
Temporary Relief: Antacids don't cure chronic issues like GERD. They are not suitable as long-term treatment options.
Adjunct Therapy: Antacids can complement diet, lifestyle changes, and other medications in a comprehensive treatment plan.
subpara: Individuals may respond differently to antacid therapy. These capsules can provide full symptom alleviation for some people but just partial or no relief for others. The results from treatment might be impacted by variables such as underlying medical issues, drug interactions, and way of living.

sections.heading: Best Antacid Medicine Available
paragraphs: The optimal medication for treating gas and acidity may be based on the symptoms‘ level and the patient’s current condition. Through the functionality of reducing stomach acid, common over-the-counter antacids capsules like Tums, Maalox, and Rolaids are the best gastric capsules and offer quick relief. The use of Proton-Pump Inhibitors (PPIs), e.g. omeprazole and H2 blockers, can effectively curb acid production, reducing the severe or chronic symptoms of GERD.
In India, a few of the most common antacid medications are:
list: Simgel
Acidflux
Omez
Olicid-S
Gelusil MPS liquid
Rabjox-DSR
subpara: It should be noted that medication can be used while making the necessary lifestyle changes, such as stress management and dietary adjustments, to ensure symptom control. It is always vital to consult a doctor who is able to make the right decision when two or more scenarios are possible.

paragraphs: For a number of people, these capsules provide an easy way to relieve the symptoms of gas burning and acid reflux. Their effectiveness in treating complex or chronic gastrointestinal diseases, on the other hand, may have some limitations. Use capsules with caution by following the dosing and safety instructions and request a provider for medical attention if the symptoms become worse or don’t go away.

blogs.title: Endoscopy on a Budget: Affordable Options and Cost-Saving Strategies for Your Procedure

medically_reviewed_by.name: Dr. G Phanindra
medically_reviewed_by.designation: Sr. Consultant Surgical Gastroenterologist, OMNI Hospitals

paragraphs: Several medical procedures can come with substantial financial implications for many, and an endoscopy is no different. Endoscopy is a widely used diagnostic and therapeutic procedure employed by healthcare providers to visualise various internal structures in the body, as well as for the treatment of a wide range of conditions.

While endoscopic procedures are crucial for diagnosing and treating various gastrointestinal conditions, the cost of these procedures can be a significant financial burden upon patients. Fortunately, there are ways in which costs for endoscopy can be minimised while still receiving quality care. In this guide, patients can find various cost-saving tips to seek affordable and reliable endoscopic treatment.

sections.heading: Understanding Endoscopy and Its Types
paragraphs: Before delving into the cost of undergoing endoscopy, it can be beneficial for patients to understand the different types of endoscopic procedures and their purposes. Endoscopic procedures allow accurate and timely diagnosis, and treatment of various health problems without having to make large incisions. Thus, surgeons can access the delicate, internal structures of the body without making incisions. Even if incisions are made, they are small and heal very quickly. Endoscopy is considered to be quite a safe procedure and is an alternative to open procedures for diagnosing and treating conditions of various systems in the body, particularly the gastrointestinal system.

There are several types of endoscopic procedures that cater to the specific requirements of patients. Most commonly, gastrointestinal endoscopy, colonoscopy, and bronchoscopy are employed. Healthcare providers may use specific endoscopic procedures for treating related medical conditions. Therefore, it is important to obtain an accurate diagnosis of a patient's health condition and discuss which endoscopic procedure can best treat the specific condition, thereby avoiding unnecessary expenses.
As mentioned previously, endoscopic procedures can be used for a number of reasons. Endoscopy is often non-surgical, and doesn't require an overnight hospital stay in most cases.

Before an endoscopy is done, an extensive evaluation of the patient is performed to ensure that the procedure is beneficial for the patient. Their complete medical and physical history may be reviewed. Physical examination may also be performed prior to the procedure. Doctors may discuss the pros and cons of the procedure, how to prepare for it, and provide specific instructions to be followed up to the day when the procedure is to be performed.

To perform an endoscopy, doctors use an endoscope, which is a long, thin tube with a camera and light mounted on its head that provides real-time images of the insides of the organs and structures in the body. The endoscope guides doctors to navigate through the internal structures and reach the site of surgery through minimal or no incisions at all. Sometimes, the endoscope can be inserted through natural openings in the mouth or the rectum. If a particular site cannot be accessed in this manner, a small incision on the skin may be made at a site nearest to the organ.

Endoscopy is mainly employed for three reasons – screening, diagnosing, and treating. It is a quick and safe alternative to open incisional procedures. The purpose of endoscopy can be summarised as follows:
list: To understand the causes of abnormalities in the body
Diagnose certain conditions by retrieving tissues from the site of problem and further testing in a laboratory in a procedure known as endoscopic biopsy
View and remove abnormal internal structures, such as gallstones, stomach ulcers, and tumours

sections.heading: Knowing Endoscopic Costs
paragraphs: The cost of endoscopy in India varies depending on the type of endoscopic procedure performed, the hospital, and the city where the procedures are conducted. Here are some cost estimates for common endoscopic procedures.
list: Bronchoscopy: ₹ 5,000 to ₹ 15,000
Laparoscopy: ₹ 10,000 to ₹ 50,000
Upper gastrointestinal endoscopy (UGIE): ₹ 4,000 to ₹ 8,000
Lower gastrointestinal endoscopy (LGIE): ₹ 5,000 to ₹ 10,000
Cystoscopy: ₹ 5,000 to ₹ 12,000
Hysteroscopy: ₹ 8,000 to ₹ 15,000

sections.heading: Get a Cost Estimate: Factors Influencing Endoscopy Costs
paragraphs: To be able to save on endoscopic procedures without compromising on the quality of care obtained, it is important to understand the factors which may affect the cost of endoscope. Some factors that may influence cost include:
list: Location: The location of the hospital where the procedure is to be performed may influence the cost of endoscope test. Hospitals with advanced equipment and state-of-the-art infrastructure may charge higher for the procedure.

Anaesthesia: Whether or not anaesthesia is used for performing endoscopic surgery may increase the total cost of endoscopy. General anaesthesia is often used for gastrointestinal endoscopic procedures.
Medical provider: The cost of endoscope test may also vary depending on the experience, expertise, and reputation of the healthcare provider performing the procedure.
Additional tests: If additional tests or procedures are performed in addition to endoscopy, they may increase the cost of the procedure.

Insurance coverage: The cost of endoscope may be partially or fully covered by insurance, if a patient has such arrangements and is insured against endoscopic procedures. Thus, having health insurance may relieve a person from bearing the burden of endoscope expenses.
subpara: The cost estimate can be obtained from the healthcare facility before the procedure.

paragraphs: Tips to Cut Down on Endoscopy Expense

Now that you have an idea about where you can save on costs based on the factors that influence costs of endoscopy, here are some strategies that can help reduce the cost of undergoing an endoscopic procedure in the future.
list: Research affordable clinics & hospitals: You can start by looking for health clinics and hospitals where they provide affordable pricing on various endoscopic procedures, and you can choose the one you need. You should also look for the reliability of such institutions without compromising on the quality of healthcare provided. Compare different pricing on endoscopic procedures at various clinics and hospitals to single out low-cost endoscope services.

Look for reviews & recommendations: The best way to do this is to look for Google reviews and patient testimonials that can be found on the particular websites of a health clinic or hospital. You can also seek recommendations from people who have undergone endoscope before and obtain information about the quality of care and affordability of a hospital or clinic.

Compare service pricing: When researching for affordable clinics and hospitals, compare their prices and services offered by different providers. Consider the cost of the procedure along with consultation fees, testing fees, hospital bed charges, etc. as part of the total costs of the endoscope procedure. Seek for a detailed breakdown of costs by discussing the expenses with the healthcare providers.

Consider location & accessibility: Hospitals and clinics located in metropolitan and tier-1 cities may charge higher than hospitals located in other cities. You can choose a clinic located closer to your home to cut down on transportation costs.

Utilise insurance coverage: It can be beneficial for patients to learn more about their insurance policy, and any additional terms and conditions that may allow for partial or complete coverage of endoscopic procedures. Check with your insurance provider to determine the extent of the entire process from hospital admission till discharge.

paragraphs: Endoscopy is a useful tool that helps diagnose and treat a plethora of medical conditions. Endoscopic procedures can be costly, especially in metropolitan cities. It is possible to minimise the cost of endoscopy through various measures and ensuring that patients can get quality healthcare at an affordable cost. Seek consultation with your healthcare provider to understand the entire cost of endoscope and associated costs to find out where you can reduce your expenditure.

blogs.title: Improve Gut Health: Recognise the Signs of an Unhealthy Gut

paragraphs: Our gut is essential for maintaining overall body health by promoting nutrition absorption from food, but we often ignore the cries for help from our gut. Millions of people suffer from gut-related problems such as irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) and gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD). Gut health can be influenced by a number of factors, ranging from genetics to what we eat on a daily basis to Stress.

When our gut is functioning properly, there is a healthy balance of good bacteria in the gut that helps process food, absorb nutrients, fight against diseases, and remove toxins from the body. But when the gut is upset, a person may experience gut-related problems such as diarrhoea, constipation, abdominal pain, gas, and abdominal bloating.

However, we often fail to recognise the warning signs our gut gives us before it gives way. Modern life has the potential to affect the gut microbiome. High levels of stress, too little sleep, excessive antibiotic use, and a diet rich in highly processed foods can lead to weight gain, disrupt hormone levels, and contribute to the development of diseases.
Here are 10 warning signs of reduced gut health before gut-related issues crop up.
1. Upset Stomach

The most common and most prominent warning sign of an unhealthy gut is an upset stomach such as gas, bloating, heartburn, constipation or diarrhoea. A healthily working gut can help to process food properly and eliminate waste matter from the body effectively.
2. Intolerance to Certain Foods

Food intolerance may be caused by the presence of poor quality bacteria in the gut, which causes disruption in the digestion of food. This can lead to symptoms of gas, bloating, nausea, diarrhoea, and sometimes abdominal pain.
3. Extreme Food Cravings

A high sugar diet, especially one which consists of processed foods and preservatives and additives, can decrease the amount of "good bacteria" in the gut. This can even lead to inflammation throughout the body, which can be a precursor to many critical diseases, even cancer.
4. Gaining or Losing Weight Unintentionally

If there has been no change in the diet or exercise habits yet an individual is experiencing weight gain or weight loss, it can be a sign of poor gut health. Improper balance of good and bad bacteria in the gut can impair the body's ability to absorb nutrients as well as the ability to process sugars and control the storage of fat. A person may suffer from unintentional weight loss due to malabsorption of nutrients.
5. Chronic Fatigue

An imbalance of bacteria in the gut can cause chronic fatigue due to the malabsorption of nutrients. Individuals who experience fatigue due to a lack of a proper diet, causing an imbalance in gut bacteria, may also suffer from irritable bowel syndrome.
6. Sleeping Troubles

When the balance of gut bacteria is off, nutrients may not be absorbed properly, which can lead to fatigue as well as sleeping difficulties. Hormones known as serotonin, responsible for the regulation of mood and sleep, are mainly produced in the gut. When there is an imbalance in the gut, it can affect the quality of mood and sleep.
7. Headaches & Migraines

People with poor gut health may be prone to gas problems and may experience GERD frequently. Experiencing gas problems can lead to frequent headaches and even trigger migraines. Some people may even experience nausea and vomiting along with headaches.
8. Autoimmune Conditions

Some studies have shown a connection between gut problems and the immune system. Due to an imbalance in the bacterial biome of the gut, many problems can occur, including systemic inflammation of the body, which can eventually lead to improper functioning of the immune system. This can gradually weaken the body to the point where autoimmune diseases may develop, in which the body's immune system attacks the body itself.
9. Skin Irritation

Skin conditions may develop due to an imbalance or an increase in certain bacteria in the gut. This can lead to irritation or the development of skin conditions, such as psoriasis. Sometimes, an unhealthy gut can cause conditions that affect other organs, indirectly leading to skin conditions.
10. Frequent Mood Changes
Frequent inflammation in the nervous system due to gut problems can lead to mood changes.
It is possible to improve gut health through dietary and lifestyle changes. Consider trying one or more of the following things:
subpara: 1. Manage Stress Levels

It is important to manage and lower stress as it is a significant factor influencing gut health. Activities such as walking, jogging, running, practising yoga, exercising, meditating, etc., can help manage stress levels.
2. Exercising Regularly

Staying physically active helps improve gut health and increases healthy microbes, especially good bacteria, while also maintaining overall body health. Regular exercise aids in efficient bowel movement, prevents many diseases, and assists in weight management.
3. Get Ample Sleep
Getting a good night's sleep helps prevent the exacerbation of gut-related problems, particularly those linked to stress, overeating, or eating too close to bedtime, which can cause indigestion.
4. Staying Hydrated
Drinking and replenishing water and fluids help alleviate gas problems and aid in digestion. Sufficient water intake is crucial for addressing gut-related issues.
5. Add Probiotic to Diet
Probiotics are important for the growth of healthy gut bacteria, which can be available in the form of yoghurt, kefir, kimchi, etc.
6. Limit Intake of Processed Foods and Added Sugars
It is extremely important to avoid eating junk food items. Instead, adding lean proteins and plant-based nutrients to the diet can help promote good gut bacteria.
7. Avoid smoking

Smoking and consuming tobacco-based products can harm the digestive system in many ways, even leading to ulcers and cancer. It is important to avoid smoking and using tobacco products as much as possible.
8. Being Mindful of Food

Certain foods can cause indigestion and trigger intolerance-related symptoms such as vomiting, nausea, and acid reflux. Therefore, it becomes important to identify and determine the trigger foods and avoid them as much as possible to prevent indigestion and gut-related problems.

Getting an annual checkup is important to ensure optimal gut and overall health. Get expert nutrition counselling and an overall health assessment by booking an appointment with our top primary care doctors at Omni Hospital.

blogs.title: Tips To Improve Your Digestion In The Winters

paragraphs: The winter season relieves long summers and presents us with fantastic, pleasant weather. As the winter settles in, we need to stay indoors and snuggle up and enjoy the comfort of our blankets. It is the best time to enjoy winter dishes, but our metabolism slows down in winter. Our bodies, being continuously exposed to cold weather, focus more on conserving heat and energy. This slows down our metabolism hence affecting our digestive systems, making stomach problems quite common.
Eating the right kind of food is important to keep digestion smooth. Decreased activity in cold weather, along with comforting calorie bombs, can intensify gastrointestinal conditions.

sections.heading: Here are some tips for managing your gut health and improving digestion in winter:
paragraphs: It is always recommended to eat seasonal vegetables. Winter brings with it a tremendous variety of vegetables that are great for your gut health. It consists of root vegetables like carrots, potatoes, turnips, sweet potatoes, etc.

Beetroots boost your immune system. Green leafy vegetables like Mustard Greens, Spinach, Fenugreek, Bathua, Cholai, etc., are packed with high fibre content that regulates your bowel movement and digestion. Consuming food with high fibre content keeps you full for a longer time hence, decreasing your urge to consume more unhealthy foods. These foods are important to regulate your blood sugar levels in winter. Include these vegetables in soups, stews, curries, and broth. Try to consume hot and cooked foods in winter; since metabolism is slow in winter, it is difficult for your digestive system to break down cold and raw foods.

sections.subheading: Take Warm Water and Hot Beverages
paragraphs: Warm drinks are obviously enjoyable in cold weather. Sipping warm water after getting up in the morning promotes good digestion. Drinking warm water 30 minutes before consuming heavy food can clean your digestive system.

You must prefer tea over cocoa and sugary drinks to maintain good gastrointestinal health. Hot tea is tasty, and you need not worry about sugar levels that can upset your digestion. You can add some herbs and spices to your tea to give you a kick of flavour. This will also enhance your immune system. Ginger and peppermint tea also improves digestion.

Exercising on a regular basis not only helps in improving physical health but also your gut health. It keeps cholesterol levels checked, which is important for a healthy heart. It might not seem very feasible to exercise outdoors due to cold weather, but getting exposed to sunlight will provide you with the needed warmth. You can exercise indoors and let your body warm up. Exercise improves blood circulation, which further improves digestion. It is also recommended in winter to avoid joint and muscle pain.

Stress also has a negative impact on the digestive system. Physical exercise, along with yoga and meditation, efficiently reduces stress. You can try other activities too that you enjoy, in order to reduce your stress.

Cold weather leads to a decrease in our fluid intake. This is not good for our digestive system. Lack of water stiffens the intestines making it difficult to pass food. This also leads to constipation. It is essential to keep yourself hydrated for the smooth movement of food and excretion. Drinking water will help you eliminate toxins from your body that can hamper your immunity. Water-based vegetables like tomatoes and radishes are also very beneficial.

sections.subheading: Add Ghee to Your Daily Diet
paragraphs: In north India, many people use Ghee to prepare different winter delights, like Gondh ke laddoo, Panjiri, and Moong dal ka Halwa, to keep their bodies warm and their immune systems strong in winter. In cold nippy weather, Ghee supports the immune system in addition to the functionality of the digestive system. It has fat-soluble vitamins that aid in weight loss. Ghee helps in balancing hormones and maintaining healthy cholesterol. It also helps healthy gut bacteria, which helps in smooth digestion. In most Indian households, Ghee has been replaced with refined oils, which are considered a blunder by many nutritionists and health practitioners.

Taking high-fibre food with your meal regulates and boosts digestion, and along with this, they keep your blood sugar in level. High-fibre food maintains heart health by reducing the risk of brain stroke and hypertension. A good diet highly rich in fibre helps us to maintain our weight by keeping us full for a longer duration and curbing unwanted cravings. You can get fibre intake from many seasonal vegetables and fruits like carrots, radishes, guava, and apples.

You must avoid the intake of processed and junk food and foods high in sugar content. These slow down your digestion process and cause bloating as they do not provide the nutrients and enzymes needed to digest food.

sections.subheading: Take Herbs & Spices in Your Food
paragraphs: To keep your body warm and also boost your digestion in the nippy winter season, you should add spices and herbs to your food. Spices and herbs like turmeric, garlic, ginger, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and cardamom, etc., are well known to help or boost your digestion and also trigger your digestive fire, which helps in the strengthening of your immune system. Many people use these herbs and spices in their daily tea or warm beverages like Desi Kadha, Soups, and Broth which they take in winter with curries and desserts.

Winter brings itself cravings to consume spicy, hot dishes, and we feel hungry often and consequently consume more food. All these factors have a negative impact on our digestive system. Fortunately, winter also brings a variety of fibrous vegetables that are a blessing to our digestive system.

Follow the above tips to maintain your gut health. Along with these tips, getting good sleep is also important for your gut health. It leads to better stress management, fewer hormone fluctuations, and controlling obesity. However, if you have a chronic problem with digestion, you can consult the certified gastrointestinal doctors at Omni Hospital. The medical professionals and staff at Omni Hospital possess years of experience and always resort to the patient-centric approach. They are highly qualified in treating basic to chronic problems while providing precise medical advice.

blogs.title: Stay Aware Because “Hepatitis Can’t Wait!”
blogs.medically_reviewed_by: Dr V Gopalakrishna, MBBS, MD (General Medicine), DM (Gastroenterology), Consultant Gastroenterologist & Hepatologist, OMNI Hospitals, Kukatpally

paragraphs: Hepatitis is a liver infection that causes inflammation. It is caused by a viral infection, but there can be multiple reasons for the same disease, hepatitis can be caused by drugs, narcotics, poisons, or alcohol are examples of these. Autoimmune hepatitis is a condition in which your body produces antibodies that attack your liver tissue.
The right upper portion of your belly houses your liver. It has several important activities that affect your body’s metabolism, including:
list: Bile production for digestion
Filtering toxins from the body
Excretion of bilirubin (a result of broken-down red blood cells), cholesterol, hormones, and medications
Carbohydrate, fat and protein breakdown
Controlling enzymes, which are specialised proteins that are required for biological processes
Synthesising blood proteins, such as albumin, storage of glycogen (a type of sugar), minerals, and vitamins (A, D, E and K), synthesis of clotting factors
subpara: Hepatitis A, B, C, D, and E are viral illnesses of the liver that are classed as Hepatitis. A distinct virus causes each type of virally transmitted hepatitis.

paragraphs: Hepatitis A

Hepatitis A is an acute, short-term condition caused by Hepatitis A viral infection (HAV). The most common way to contract this type of hepatitis is to eat or drink food or water contaminated with hepatitis A-infected faeces.
Hepatitis B

Hepatitis B gets spread through contact with infectious body fluids containing the Hepatitis B virus. These include blood, vaginal secretions, or sperm. It also spreads through injecting drugs, having sex with an infected partner, or sharing razors with an infected person.
Hepatitis C
This is caused by Hepatitis C virus (HCV). Hepatitis C gets spread by direct contact with contaminated bodily fluids, most commonly through sharing of needles and sexual interaction.
Hepatitis D

Hepatitis D, often known as delta hepatitis, is a devastating liver illness caused by the Hepatitis D virus (HDV). HDV gets spread by coming into contact with infected blood. It is an uncommon hepatitis that only occurs when hepatitis B is present. The hepatitis D virus cannot proliferate unless hepatitis B is present.
Hepatitis E
Hepatitis E is mostly present in places with poor sanitation, and it’s usually contracted by ingesting contaminated food or water.
Symptoms of Hepatitis

You may not have symptoms at first if you have chronic infectious forms of hepatitis, such as hepatitis B and C. Symptoms may not sometimes appear until the infection has a severe effect on liver function.
Acute hepatitis symptoms and signs arise quickly. They are:
list: Flu-like symptoms weakness
Abdominal discomfort, dark urine, pale stool
Unexplained weight loss because of loss of appetite
Jaundice-like symptoms include yellow skin and eyes
sections.subpara: Because chronic hepatitis progresses slowly, many signs and symptoms may go unnoticed and may take some time to develop.

paragraphs: Prevention
list: Maintain adequate hygiene
Don’t share/reuse injection needles
Don’t share razors and other personal hygiene equipment
Never use another person’s toothbrush
Don’t touch spilled blood
Use precautions during sexual intercourse and intimate sexual contact
Get vaccinated

paragraphs: Diagnosis
There are different ways to diagnose different hepatitis.
list: Liver Function Tests
Detailed Blood Tests
Liver Biopsy
Abdominal Ultrasound to check:
Fluid in abdomen
Liver damage and enlargement
Liver tumours

paragraphs: Treatment
list: Hepatitis A is a short-term infection. If your symptoms are causing you a lot of pain, bed rest is prescribed. Follow your doctor’s hydration and nutrition instructions if you have vomiting or diarrhoea.
Acute hepatitis B in most of the individuals relieves with symptomatic treatment. Antiviral medicines are used to treat chronic hepatitis B.

Hepatitis C is treated with antiviral medicines in both acute and chronic forms. People who develop cirrhosis (liver scarring) or liver illness because of chronic hepatitis C may be eligible for a liver transplant.
At present, there are no antiviral drugs available to treat hepatitis D. Hepatitis D can be avoided by having the hepatitis B vaccine.
Hepatitis E is currently treated with no specific medicinal therapy. Because the illness is so common, it usually goes away on its own.

paragraphs: Crohn’s disease is a type of inflammatory bowel disease. It mostly occurs in the small intestine and the colon. It can affect any part of your gastrointestinal (GI) tract, from your mouth to your anal canal.

list: Long-lasting diarrhea
Weight loss
Fever
Belly pain and tenderness
Rectal bleeding
Fatigue
Loss of appetite
Weight loss

paragraphs: There are many theories about the causes Crohn's disease, but none of them have been proven. Researchers believe that Crohn's disease is caused by a combination of these factors:
list: Immune system problems
Genetics
Environmental factors

paragraphs: There isn't any single test to diagnose Crohn's disease. This condition has many symptoms that are the same as other health problems. The doctor may use several types of tests to make a diagnosis:
list: Blood tests help your doctor to look for certain indicators of potential problems, such as anaemia and inflammation
A stool test can help your doctor detect blood in your GI tract
An endoscopy may be done to get a better image of the inside of the upper gastrointestinal tract and a colonoscopy to examine the large bowel
Imaging tests like CT scans and MRI scans gives more detail than an X-ray. Both tests allows the doctor to see specific areas of the tissues and organs of the body
Doctor also extracts a tissue sample or biopsy, taken during an endoscopy or colonoscopy for a closer look at the intestinal tract tissue

paragraphs: Treatment may involve medication, surgery, and nutritional supplements.
The main aim is to control inflammation, rectify nutritional problems and relieve symptoms.
Crohn’s disease cannot be cured but some treatments can help manage the disease by reducing the number of times a patient experiences recurrences.

subsections.heading: Crohn’s disease treatment depends on
list: where the inflammation is situated
severity of the disease
the patient’s response to previous treatment for recurring symptoms
complications
Anti-inflammation drugs
Antibiotics
Anti-diarrheal and fluid replacements

paragraphs: At some point Crohn’s disease patients may need surgery. Surgery can relieve symptoms that did not respond to medication or correct the complications, such as abscess, perforation, bleeding, and blockage. Removing part of the intestine can help, but it does not cure Crohn’s disease. In some cases, a colectomy is needed, in which the whole colon is removed. Most people with Crohn’s disease can live normal and active lives successfully.

medically_reviewed_by.name: Dr Raja Prasad
medically_reviewed_by.designation: Sr Consultant Surgical Gastroenterologist, OMNI Hospitals, Kukatpally

paragraphs: The COVID-19 pandemic has put us to face a lot of challenges both socially and in respect to health. We have been experiencing an extraordinary challenge from the novel coronavirus pandemic. Healthcare systems and governments all over the world have been fighting against COVID-19 and there is still a massive surge in the number of case world over.
The magnitude of the problem has left most of the systems helpless and now probably the only solution lies in individual people rather than putting the onus on the government or the healthcare.

So what is the solution or measures that we need to take for a safe glide over from this pandemic? The sayings 'Ignorance is bliss' and 'knowledge is power' are both playing against us. How? Ignorance though is bliss keeps a person at high risk of getting infected and also putting others at risk. The amount of information (knowledge) available on the novel coronavirus is so exhaustive that the more we know about the disease the less we know what to do about it.

Coronavirus has a varied presentation from being asymptomatic to severe respiratory distress syndrome. The effect of the virus is also very unpredictable causing a severe inflammatory response in even an otherwise healthy individual irrespective of age though children are generally spared. Coronavirus not only attacks the lungs but can practically affect any organ system in the body including the heart, nerves, kidneys, gastro-intestines, liver and skin.

Gastrointestinal symptoms can sometimes be the only presenting symptoms for corona infection. The symptoms can be anosmia (loss of smell), nausea, anorexia (decrease in appetite), abdominal cramps and diarrhoea. Most of these symptoms are self-limiting and patients do recover in a few days. However, a few of these patients may progress to a severe lung involvement needing hospitalisation and treatment.

So it is very important to be aware of these symptoms for recognition of the disease so that adequate measures can be taken to prevent not only the spread of the disease but also to be wary of the fact that any respiratory symptoms that follow may need an institutional care.

People with chronic digestive conditions such as Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD), digestive cancers and liver diseases could be at high risk of COVID-19 infection. So they should be more careful and take precautions like maintaining personal hygiene, social distancing, use of face mask, avoiding large gathering is the best way of preventing the spread or chances of acquiring the disease. It is also important to maintain proper gut health and a healthy gut is a key to good health.

Staying healthy both physically and mentally will surely help us tide over the present difficult times. Maintaining a healthy gut by having plenty of green leafy vegetables, high protein foods (egg, lean meat, fish), fruits, wholegrain, probiotics like yoghurt and adequate hydration will probably give a better chance to fight the disease.
A healthy mind, body and adequate personal care is the best way to prevent or spread the disease.
Eat healthy, live healthy. Future of a healthy world (Free from Coronavirus) starts with you.
